paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper reports a novel pathogenic variant in the KCNH2 gene associated with long QT syndrome in an Iranian family, along with penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

patients.phenotype: Long QT syndrome, with episodes of fainting and sudden cardiac death

individual_records.evidence_sentence: According to the proband, her mother (I‐2; Figure 1A) had SCD aged 25.
According to the proband, her sister (II‐3; Figure 1A) had SCD aged 39 years.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Experienced fainting episodes, diagnosed with LQT2
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The proband had experienced fainting at 28 years of age during pregnancy.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Similar fainting experiences as her mother
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The proband's daughter (III‐4; Figure 1A) had a similar experience to her mother.

functional_data.summary: The c.1425C>A variant is a nonsense mutation leading to a truncated protein, predicted to be pathogenic.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the family, following an autosomal dominant pattern.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on segregation analysis and computational predictions.
variants.additional_notes: This is the first report of this variant from Iran.
key_quotes: The detected c.1425C>A is a novel variant to be reported from Iran for the first time.
According to the segregation analysis results, LQT2 was inherited in this pedigree with an autosomal dominant pattern.

tables_processed.table_caption: Bioinformatics analysis of pathogenic, likely pathogenic, unknown significance reported variants in KCNH2 gene related to long QT.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
